20110106060044.000|20110106060046.000|TR0|in a landfill.  Will they deepen the 
20110106060046.000|20110106060048.000|TR0|mystery of his final hours or provide

20110106060101.000|20110106060103.000|TR0|the powerful drug that ended Jackson's 
20110106060103.000|20110106060105.000|TR0|life.

20110106060115.000|20110106060117.000|TR0|"The British Medical Journal," "BMJ," did 
20110106060117.000|20110106060119.000|TR0|something extremely rare for a scientific 
20110106060119.000|20110106060121.000|TR0|journal.  It accused a researcher, Andrew 
20110106060121.000|20110106060123.000|TR0|Wakefield, of outright fraud.
20110106060123.000|20110106060125.000|TR0|
20110106060125.000|20110106060127.000|TR0|Now, Wakefield is not just any researcher. 
20110106060127.000|20110106060129.000|TR0| His 1998 study on autism and childhood 
20110106060129.000|20110106060131.000|TR0|vaccines literally changed the way many 
20110106060131.000|20110106060133.000|TR0|parents think about vaccines.  The study 
20110106060133.000|20110106060135.000|TR0|was based on just 12 children. That's 
20110106060135.000|20110106060137.000|TR0|right, 12 children.  But many parents 
20110106060137.000|20110106060139.000|TR0|desperate for answers around the world 
20110106060139.000|20110106060141.000|TR0|embraced Wakefield's claim that he had 
20110106060141.000|20110106060143.000|TR0|found a link between autism and the 
20110106060143.000|20110106060145.000|TR0|vaccine for measles, mumps and rubella.
20110106060145.000|20110106060147.000|TR0|

20110106060149.000|20110106060150.000|TR0|vocal autism activist whose son was 
20110106060150.000|20110106060152.000|TR0|diagnosed with the disorder, has helped 
20110106060152.000|20110106060154.000|TR0|spread the message, using Wakefield's 
20110106060154.000|20110106060156.000|TR0|research as ammunition.

20110106060323.000|20110106060325.000|TR0|
20110106060325.000|20110106060327.000|TR0|COOPER:  For the record, the mercury-based 
20110106060327.000|20110106060329.000|TR0|preservative he's talking about was 
20110106060329.000|20110106060331.000|TR0|removed from most childhood vaccines in 
20110106060331.000|20110106060332.000|TR0|2001, yet autism rates have continued to 
20110106060332.000|20110106060334.000|TR0|climb.
20110106060334.000|20110106060336.000|TR0|
20110106060336.000|20110106060338.000|TR0|Representative Burton made those remarks 
20110106060338.000|20110106060340.000|TR0|in 2008.  And, by then, Wakefield's study, 
20110106060340.000|20110106060342.000|TR0|which was first published in "The Lancet" 
20110106060342.000|20110106060344.000|TR0|in 1998, had come under heavy fire in the 
20110106060344.000|20110106060346.000|TR0|scientific community.  In 2004, 10 of 
20110106060346.000|20110106060348.000|TR0|Wakefield's 12 co-authors removed their 
20110106060348.000|20110106060350.000|TR0|names from the paper.
20110106060350.000|20110106060352.000|TR0|
20110106060352.000|20110106060354.000|TR0|Last year, "The Lancet" retracted the 
20110106060354.000|20110106060356.000|TR0|study, citing numerous problems with its 
20110106060356.000|20110106060358.000|TR0|methods, as well as ethical missteps and 
20110106060358.000|20110106060400.000|TR0|financial conflicts of interest.  A few 
20110106060400.000|20110106060402.000|TR0|months later, Wakefield lost his license 
20110106060402.000|20110106060404.000|TR0|to practice medicine in the U.K.  It was 
20110106060404.000|20110106060406.000|TR0|taken away from him.
20110106060406.000|20110106060408.000|TR0|
20110106060408.000|20110106060410.000|TR0|And now tonight, the medical journal "BMJ" 
20110106060410.000|20110106060412.000|TR0|is calling his study more than just bad 
20110106060412.000|20110106060414.000|TR0|science.  Its editors say it is -- quote 
20110106060414.000|20110106060416.000|TR0|-- "an elaborate fraud that has done 
20110106060416.000|20110106060418.000|TR0|long-lasting damage to the public's 
20110106060418.000|20110106060420.000|TR0|health."
20110106060420.000|20110106060422.000|TR0|
20110106060422.000|20110106060423.000|TR0|They're talking about the fact that a lot 
20110106060423.000|20110106060425.000|TR0|of parents stopped vaccinating their kids 
20110106060425.000|20110106060427.000|TR0|after Wakefield's study came out, both in 
20110106060427.000|20110106060429.000|TR0|England and in the United States.  In 
20110106060429.000|20110106060431.000|TR0|recent years, there have been measles 
20110106060431.000|20110106060433.000|TR0|outbreaks in California, Illinois, New 
20110106060433.000|20110106060435.000|TR0|York, Wisconsin.  Last year in California, 
20110106060435.000|20110106060437.000|TR0|there were more cases of whooping cough 
20110106060437.000|20110106060439.000|TR0|than in any year since 1947.  Ten children 
20110106060439.000|20110106060441.000|TR0|died, 10 infants.       But Andrew 
20110106060441.000|20110106060443.000|TR0|Wakefield hasn't lost his loyal following, 
20110106060443.000|20110106060445.000|TR0|even though his study has been debunked, 
20110106060445.000|20110106060447.000|TR0|even after he's lost his medical license. 
20110106060447.000|20110106060449.000|TR0|On the contrary, his supporters see him as 
20110106060449.000|20110106060451.000|TR0|a victim.
20110106060451.000|20110106060453.000|TR0|
20110106060453.000|20110106060455.000|TR0|In a statement last February, Jenny 
20110106060455.000|20110106060457.000|TR0|McCarthy and actor Jim Carrey said -- and 
20110106060457.000|20110106060459.000|TR0|I quote -- "It is our most sincere belief 
20110106060459.000|20110106060501.000|TR0|that Dr. Wakefield and parents of children 
20110106060501.000|20110106060503.000|TR0|with autism around the world are being 
20110106060503.000|20110106060505.000|TR0|subjected to a remarkable media campaign 
20110106060505.000|20110106060507.000|TR0|engineered by vaccine manufacturers.  Dr. 
20110106060507.000|20110106060509.000|TR0|Wakefield is being vilified through a 
20110106060509.000|20110106060511.000|TR0|well- orchestrated smear campaign."
20110106060511.000|20110106060513.000|TR0|
20110106060513.000|20110106060514.000|TR0|And here's what Congressman Burton said in 
20110106060514.000|20110106060516.000|TR0|2002 at a hearing on autism: "Dr. 
20110106060516.000|20110106060518.000|TR0|Wakefield, like many scientists who blaze 
20110106060518.000|20110106060520.000|TR0|new trails, has been attacked by his own 
20110106060520.000|20110106060522.000|TR0|profession.  He's been forced out of his 
20110106060522.000|20110106060524.000|TR0|position in the Royal Free Hospital in 
20110106060524.000|20110106060526.000|TR0|England.  He and his colleagues have 
20110106060526.000|20110106060528.000|TR0|fought an uphill battle to continue the

20110106060532.000|20110106060534.000|TR0|enterocolitis."
20110106060534.000|20110106060536.000|TR0|
20110106060536.000|20110106060538.000|TR0|But, tonight, the message from the "BMJ"

20110106060540.000|20110106060542.000|TR0|Wakefield's research, they contend, has 
20110106060542.000|20110106060544.000|TR0|been a fraud. Starting tonight, the

20110106060906.000|20110106060908.000|TR0|conspiracy against you.  Is that -- is

20110106060910.000|20110106060912.000|TR0|

20110106060914.000|20110106060916.000|TR0|

20110106060918.000|20110106060920.000|TR0|attempt to crush any investigation into 
20110106060920.000|20110106060922.000|TR0|valid vaccine safety concerns, not just my 
20110106060922.000|20110106060924.000|TR0|concerns.  I'm here at a meeting of

20110106061536.000|20110106061538.000|TR0|Journal," "BMJ," lobbed a bombshell into

20110106061544.000|20110106061546.000|TR0|controversial 1998 study linking autism to

20110106061548.000|20110106061550.000|TR0|kids is fraudulent -- not just mistaken,

20110106063746.000|20110106063748.000|TR0|$10 million to contain, and resulted in a 
20110106063748.000|20110106063750.000|TR0|quarantine of dozens of children.
20110106063750.000|20110106063752.000|TR0|
20110106063752.000|20110106063754.000|TR0|That meant that those parents then had to 
20110106063754.000|20110106063756.000|TR0|find some way to take care of those kids, 
20110106063756.000|20110106063758.000|TR0|either not go to work or pay for day care. 
20110106063758.000|20110106063800.000|TR0| So, even when you have a case like with 
20110106063800.000|20110106063802.000|TR0|that measles epidemic, where it's true 
20110106063802.000|20110106063804.000|TR0|that children didn't die, you had one 
20110106063804.000|20110106063806.000|TR0|infant that was hospitalized for a serious 
20110106063806.000|20110106063808.000|TR0|amount of time, and dozens of families 
20110106063808.000|20110106063810.000|TR0|that had to pay an enormous amount of 
20110106063810.000|20110106063812.000|TR0|money because of this.
20110106063812.000|20110106063814.000|TR0|
20110106063814.000|20110106063816.000|TR0|COOPER:  This is maybe an unfair and an 
20110106063816.000|20110106063818.000|TR0|impossible question to answer, is, do you 
20110106063818.000|20110106063820.000|TR0|believe Wakefield believes what he's 
20110106063820.000|20110106063822.000|TR0|saying?
20110106063822.000|20110106063824.000|TR0|
20110106063824.000|20110106063825.000|TR0|MNOOKIN:  I talked to him several times 
20110106063825.000|20110106063827.000|TR0|over the past several years.  Mostly in 
20110106063827.000|20110106063829.000|TR0|the context of these conferences that he 
20110106063829.000|20110106063831.000|TR0|was referring to where he's surrounded by 
20110106063831.000|20110106063833.000|TR0|people who adulate him.
20110106063833.000|20110106063835.000|TR0|

20110106063837.000|20110106063839.000|TR0|at this point, he's been living in this

20110106063849.000|20110106063851.000|TR0|the science is not...
20110106063851.000|20110106063853.000|TR0|
20110106063853.000|20110106063855.000|TR0|COOPER:  Has the media played a role in 
20110106063855.000|20110106063857.000|TR0|perpetuating this? Because you see in a 
20110106063857.000|20110106063859.000|TR0|lot of TV shows, you know, on this 
20110106063859.000|20110106063901.000|TR0|subject, several sides represented.  You 
20110106063901.000|20110106063903.000|TR0|have the people who believe the vaccines 
20110106063903.000|20110106063905.000|TR0|cause autism and the people who don't.  
20110106063905.000|20110106063907.000|TR0|And it seems to give equal credence, you 
20110106063907.000|20110106063909.000|TR0|know.

20110106063918.000|20110106063920.000|TR0|the problem worse?  Has that given the -- 
20110106063920.000|20110106063922.000|TR0|this side more credence?
20110106063922.000|20110106063924.000|TR0|
20110106063924.000|20110106063926.000|TR0|MNOOKIN:  I think absolutely.  And an 
20110106063926.000|20110106063928.000|TR0|example I use is there are people who 
20110106063928.000|20110106063930.000|TR0|believe the earth is flat.  Most people 
20110106063930.000|20110106063932.000|TR0|obviously do not, but if you had one 
20110106063932.000|20110106063934.000|TR0|person who believed the earth is flat and 
20110106063934.000|20110106063936.000|TR0|one person who said, "No, it's actually 
20110106063936.000|20110106063938.000|TR0|round," and they were discussing the issue 
20110106063938.000|20110106063940.000|TR0|together, it would seem that the consensus 
20110106063940.000|20110106063942.000|TR0|was split 50/50.
20110106063942.000|20110106063944.000|TR0|
20110106063944.000|20110106063946.000|TR0|So here you have a situation in which you 
20110106063946.000|20110106063948.000|TR0|have millions of doctors, public health 
20110106063948.000|20110106063950.000|TR0|officials, all coming down on one side, 
20110106063950.000|20110106063952.000|TR0|and then Andrew Wakefield and a very small

20110106063954.000|20110106063956.000|TR0|him, a miniscule number of people, saying, 
20110106063956.000|20110106063958.000|TR0|"No, this is what's actually going on."    
20110106063958.000|20110106064000.000|TR0|   But because we can't present millions 
20110106064000.000|20110106064002.000|TR0|of points of view or millions of people, 
20110106064002.000|20110106064004.000|TR0|it ends up sounding -- there's this false 
20110106064004.000|20110106064006.000|TR0|equivalency.  It ends up sounding on the 
20110106064006.000|20110106064007.000|TR0|one hand, on the other hand, when there

20110106064711.000|20110106064713.000|TR0|foiled a car theft the other day when the 
20110106064713.000|20110106064715.000|TR0|victim says he saw a guy trying to Jimmy 
20110106064715.000|20110106064717.000|TR0|his car door when the spandexed crime
